page.title: 18Life in Egerton _ one view
page.content: As I write this my cats are sitting near me, logs from my orchard burn on the fire, and there is fruit and goat's milk of my own producing in my kitchen. This, in part at least, is what living in Egerton means to me. Egerton is still a village community. Many of my friends have come to the village fairly recently but the core of the village is based on families who have been here for generationa, This is important to me as much as to Egerton. Closely controlled planning and a reasonably healthy supply of local employment, much of it related to agriculture, will help to ensure it remains so. The church communities in the vill_ age are a drawing together of old and new inhabitants, providing for me a sense of continuity and support.
